metadata.title: Friday, 25th February, 2022
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) when the construction of the Mufulira - Ndola road will be completed;
(b) what the cause of the delay in completing the project is;
(c) what the total cost of the project is;
(d) how much money had been paid to the contractor, as of September, 2021; and
(e) when the outstanding amount will be paid.
(a) whether the Government is aware of the critical shortage of drugs in health facilities in Lufubu District; and
(b) if so, what measures the Government is taking to ensure that the health facilities are supplied with adequate drugs.
(a) when the following Schools in Feira Parliamentary Constituency will be electrified:
(i) Mangelengele Primary; (ii) Chilombwe Primary; (iii) Mandombe Primary; (iv) Chimutengo Primary;
(v) Chankasi Primary; (vi) Kaungu B Primary; (vii) Chilukusha Primary; and (viii) Kaunga Secondary; and
(b) what the cause of the delay in electrifying the schools is.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing, and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a direct road from Livingstone to Mulobezi; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Labour and Social Security
parts: (a) when the Government will review the current minimum wage;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to introduce a minimum wage in the mining sector;
(c) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(d) if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) why the construction of the Katete Police Station has stalled;
(b) when the project will resume;
(c) why the contract was terminated;
(d) whether a new contractor has been identified; and
(e) if so, what the name of the new contractor is.

questions.minister: Minister of Green Economy and Environment
parts: (a) what the progress on the implementation of the Pilot Project for Climate Resilience in Kalabo District is;
(b) how many clubs benefitted from the Programme, as of September, 2021;
(c) what activities the clubs were engaged in; and
(d) how much money was allocated to each club.

questions.minister: Minister of Labour and Social Security
parts: (a) whether the Government is aware that some media houses do not allow their employees to join labour unions of their choice;
(b) if so, whether the practice is not a violation of the employeesâ€™ rights; and
(c) if so, what measures are being taken to address the anomaly.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to implement the Zambia-Saudi Arabia Goat Export Agreement;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) how many goats are earmarked for export, per year; and
(d) what measures have been taken to ensure that the targeted number of goats for export is met at all material times.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to tar the Sansamwenje - Mzoche - Kanyala road in Isoka Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why. __________________________
